subject: Re: [junit] Problem with assert method when it is in a for  loop
msgSnippet: ... Please read JUnit: A Starter Guide at http://www.diasparsoftware.com under Articles/Presentations. A failure ends a test. If your loop is in a single test
messageBody:
>So said veera sekhar on 2003-05-06 --------------------
>Hi All,
> The problem iam facing is like this...
>In a for loop iam just calling the assertEquals()
>method.when say counter is 5 out of 10 then if any
>failure occurs then it is stoping there itself without
>proceeding to counter 6.so How to come out this
>problem.My requirement is in such a way that i should
>print the result of all the assertEquals() method
>to the end of the for loop counter.

Please read JUnit: A Starter Guide at http://www.diasparsoftware.com under Articles/Presentations. A failure ends a test. If your loop is in a single test method, then that's it.

If you really need 10 tests then create the TestSuite by hand.

I'll write this up tonight if I have the time.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
